original:
State capitalism is an economic system characterized by significant government involvement in the economy, primarily through state-owned enterprises that operate as commercial, profit-seeking entities. This model is prevalent in various regions, including Western and Northern Europe, as well as Japan, although it manifests in different configurations across these areas.
